com.tomtom.speedtools.services.push

Interface PushNotificationProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    APNSConnector, GCMConnector

    public interface PushNotificationProvider
    Implementation of this interface can push notifications to an underlying push service.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canGetObsoletePushTokens()
      Some providers are not able to fetch obsolete tokens from the underlying push service.
      Set<PushToken> getObsoletePushTokens()
      This method returns push channel IDs that have been used earlier, but which are considered to be no longer valid, according to the push notification provider.
      NotificationChannelType getSupportedNotificationChannelType()
      Method returns supported NotificationChannelType.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Some providers may be disabled at startup. this method returns true in case the provider instance is enabled, false otherwise.
      PushToken push(Notification notification, PushToken pushToken)
      Method pushes Notification to given channel id.

    • Method Detail

      • push

        PushToken push(@Nonnull
               Notification notification,
               @Nonnull
               PushToken pushToken)
        throws PushConnectionException,
               InvalidPushTokenException
        Method pushes Notification to given channel id.
        Parameters:
        notification - The Notification to push.
        pushToken - The PushToken to push to.
        Returns:
        The PushToken the provider is using for the registration. This could have been updated.
        Throws:
        PushConnectionException - Thrown in case a connection could not me made to push service.
        InvalidPushTokenException - Thrown in case the provider has marked the PushToken invalid. This PushToken should not be used anymore.

      • getSupportedNotificationChannelType

        @Nonnull
NotificationChannelType getSupportedNotificationChannelType()
        Method returns supported NotificationChannelType.
        Returns:
        The NotificationChannelType that this instance supports.

      • getObsoletePushTokens

        @Nonnull
Set<PushToken> getObsoletePushTokens()
        This method returns push channel IDs that have been used earlier, but which are considered to be no longer valid, according to the push notification provider. This will happen when a customer removes an application from its device for instance. References can safely be removed.
        Returns:
        A set of obsolete push channels or empty.

      • canGetObsoletePushTokens

        boolean canGetObsoletePushTokens()
        Some providers are not able to fetch obsolete tokens from the underlying push service. This methods returns true for implementations that do support this and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True for implementations that support fetching of obsolete tokens and false otherwise.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Some providers may be disabled at startup. this method returns true in case the provider instance is enabled, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True in case the provider instance is enabled, false otherwise.
